Title: Moby Dick (1)
Description: An epic tale of obsession and revenge, Moby Dick follows Captain Ahab’s relentless pursuit of the great white whale.

Title: The Great Gatsby (2)
Description: F. Scott Fitzgerald's masterpiece, exploring themes of wealth, love, and the American Dream in 1920s America.

Title: To Kill a Mockingbird (3)
Description: A gripping novel set in the American South, exploring racial injustice through the eyes of young Scout Finch.
George Orwell’s dystopian classic, depicting a totalitarian regime that uses surveillance and mind control to maintain power.

Title: Pride and Prejudice (5)
Description: Jane Austen's timeless romantic comedy about the manners and matrimony in early 19th-century England.

Title: War and Peace (6)
Description: Leo Tolstoy’s historical novel set during the Napoleonic Wars, blending individual stories with sweeping political and social events.

Title: Brave New World (7)
Description: Aldous Huxley’s dystopian novel, imagining a future world of genetically engineered citizens and an all-powerful state.

Title: Moby Dick (8)
Description: Another edition of Herman Melville’s great American novel about the obsessive hunt for a mighty whale.

Title: Brave New World (9)
Description: A vision of a futuristic society where technological advancements control the human experience.

Title: Brave New World (10)
Description: A new edition of Huxley’s classic, exploring how society controls its citizens through technology and pleasure.

Title: To Kill a Mockingbird (11)
Description: Another edition of Harper Lee’s beloved novel about race, justice, and morality in the Deep South.

Title: War and Peace (12)
Description: A new edition of Tolstoy’s monumental epic of love and loss during the Napoleonic Wars.

Title: The Odyssey (13)
Description: Homer’s ancient Greek epic, chronicling the adventures of Odysseus as he struggles to return home after the Trojan War.

Title: The Catcher in the Rye (14)
Description: J.D. Salinger’s classic coming-of-age story about teenage alienation and the search for identity.

Title: The Hobbit (15)
Description: J.R.R. Tolkien’s beloved fantasy novel about Bilbo Baggins’ quest to win treasure and avoid danger.

Title: Jane Eyre (16)
Description: Charlotte Brontë’s novel about the life and struggles of a young orphan, Jane Eyre, as she grows into adulthood.

Title: Frankenstein (17)
Description: Mary Shelley’s gothic horror novel about the creation of a monster and the moral questions surrounding scientific progress.
